thread.title: The Blackhawks' massive Stanley Cup rings are here
thread.title_full: The Blackhawks' massive Stanley Cup rings are here | Chicago Sun-Times

title: The Blackhawks' massive Stanley Cup rings are here
text:
Nearly four months after capturing their third Stanley Cup in six years, the Blackhawks received their championship rings.
The rings, which are made of 355 diamonds set in 14 karat white gold, were distributed in a private ceremony Sunday night in downtown Chicago, according to a press release .
Behold. Thank you @Jostens ! pic.twitter.com/3Jl6V32WVS
— Chicago Blackhawks (@NHLBlackhawks) October 5, 2015
This side's OK too. pic.twitter.com/RPK4Pys0hq
— Chicago Blackhawks (@NHLBlackhawks) October 5, 2015
From the Blackhawks :
The ring top boasts the Blackhawks logo created with custom-cut diamonds sitting atop a bed of 50 custom princess-cut diamonds. The words STANLEY CUP CHAMPIONS surrounds the top and bottom of the ring top, giving way to four shimmering rows of round pave-set diamonds. The four rows of diamonds are master set and cascade down the side of the ring in a waterfall effect.
The left side features all six Stanley Cup trophies the team has won. Round pave-set diamonds are stacked up to form the base of each trophy. The right side features the Blackhawks secondary logo created with pear and round pave-set diamonds, as well as each player’s name and number. Inside, the team’s motto of ONE GOAL is featured along with a silhouette of the trophy. The Blackhawks 2015 postseason opponents and series scores are also included.
Compare all three Stanley Cups rings: 2015: Behold. Thank you @Jostens ! pic.twitter.com/3Jl6V32WVS
— Chicago Blackhawks (@NHLBlackhawks) October 5, 2015
2013: 2013 Chicago Blackhawks Stanley cup rings pretty sweet if I might add pic.twitter.com/hxDyw7pmse
— LongLiveHockey (@LongLiveHockey) December 4, 2013
2010: #Sport #Goods 2010 Chicago #Blackhawks Stanley Cup championship rings size 11 http://t.co/N3pA4J0mVa #Discount #Buy pic.twitter.com/uf5xlRHc21
— Chi Blackhawks Mall (@BlackhawksMall) September 29, 2015
